title: Ukraine wants to stay out of Trump inquiry, says foreign minister
text:
Ukrainian officials will not testify in US Congress in impeachment investigation, Vadym Prystaiko said

Ukraine wants to stay out of Trump inquiry, says foreign minister

Ukrainian officials will not testify in the US Congress in the impeachment inquiry into Donald Trump because Kyiv does not want to get involved in the internal affairs of another country, Ukraine’s foreign minister has said.

“We don’t have anything to do with this at all,” Vadym Prystaiko told reporters on the sidelines of an investment conference in Mariupol on Tuesday. “We won’t go there, we won’t comment.”

Democrats are investigating whether there are grounds to impeach Trump over his request to Ukraine’s president, Volodymyr Zelenskiy, to investigate a domestic political rival, former vice-president Joe Biden. Biden is a frontrunner for the 2020 Democratic presidential nomination.

What Bill Taylor’s impeachment inquiry testimony tells us Read more

The top US diplomat in Ukraine, Bill Taylor, has testified that Trump made the release of US security aid to Ukraine contingent on Kyiv publicly declaring it would carry out investigations that Trump sought.

Trump has called the inquiry a “witch-hunt”. He has said there was no quid pro quo related to the $391m to help Ukraine fight Russian-backed forces in the eastern Donbass region.

Prystaiko said relations between Kyiv and Washington had not changed since the start of the impeachment row and that it was normal for the two countries to use formal and informal channels to conduct diplomacy.

“There are channels that are specially separated from the official ones, but this does not mean that the official ones don’t know what is happening,” he said.

He also said Ukraine needed to receive official requests from the US in order to open investigations.

Asked whether Ukraine had received such a request to investigate Burisma, the Ukrainian gas company where Biden’s son Hunter used to be a board member, he said that question should go to the general prosecutor’s office.

Taylor was at the same conference in Mariupol but declined to speak to the media about the impeachment inquiry.
description: Ukrainian officials will not testify in US Congress in impeachment investigation, Vadym Prystaiko said
